from 

 Create a bounding box that contains the two points

title: BoundingBox2D.corners
content:

corners 

 Returned in clockwise order from top left rotating around clockwise

title: BoundingBox2D.containingPoint
content:
BoundingBox2D.containingPoint 
containingPoint 

 Get a bounding box that contains the new point. If the box does not contain the new point, the box will grow
 to fit the new point. If the point is within the box, the same bounding box is returned.

title: BoundingBox2D.lineSegments
content:
BoundingBox2D.lineSegments 
lineSegments 

 Get the four line segments surrounding the bounding box. The lines are created from the top left point, creating
 line segments around the bounding box clockwise.

content:
BoundingBox2D.union 
union 

 Create a bounding box that contains both bounding boxes.

title: Direction2D.xy
content:
Direction2D.xy 
xy 

 Get a direction vector from the x and y components. This function takes
 care of normalizing the x and y components into the unit direction vector.
 This function also checks for the edge case where the x and y components
 are both zero. In that case, the function returns `None`.

title: Direction2D.xyLength
content:
Direction2D.xyLength 
xyLength 

 Get a direction vector from the x and y length components. This function takes
 care of normalizing the x and y components into the unit direction vector.
 This function also checks for the edge case where the x and y components
 are both zero. In that case, the function returns `None`.

title: Direction2D.xyUnsafe
content:
Direction2D.xyUnsafe 
xyUnsafe 

 Create a direction vector from the x and y components. This function
 doesn't perform either zero magnitude checks nor does it normalize the
 input vectors. This function should only be used with input constants or
 when you are sure that you aren't going to create a direction with an
 invalid state.

content:

title: LineSegment2D.from
content:
LineSegment2D.from 
from 

 Generate a line segment from two points. This doesn't perform any checks ensuring that the points are not equal.
 If that is the behavior that you want you should use <see cref="safeFrom"/> function.

title: LineSegment2D.safeFrom
content:
LineSegment2D.safeFrom 
safeFrom 

 Safely create a line segment. This function returns `None` when the two points are almost equal.
 This has to do with the <see cref="Geometry.Internal.Tolerance"/>.

title: LineSegment2D.fromPointAndVector
content:
LineSegment2D.fromPointAndVector 
fromPointAndVector 

 Create a line segment starting at point in a particular direction and length

title: LineSegment2D.intersect
content:
LineSegment2D.intersect 
intersect 

 Try to find the intersection between two lines. If the lines are parallel (even if they are overlapping) then no
 intersection is returned

plus

title: Point2D.vectorTo
content:
Point2D.vectorTo 
vectorTo 

 Be careful with the vector arguments. This function is written with piping in mind. The first point is the
 target location. The second point is the starting location.
 This is also an alias for `minus` and is `target - from`

title: Polygon2D.singleLoop
content:
Polygon2D.singleLoop 
singleLoop 

 Points that are each connected together. Polygon's have the assumption that the last point is connected back to
 the first point, so it is not necessary to explicitly add it.

title: Vector2D.distanceSquaredTo
content:
Vector2D.distanceSquaredTo 
distanceSquaredTo

 optimize some algorithms because you remove a square root call from the
 calculation which can be an expensive operation.
